div.l: To bedde went the dougler doughter dougler doughter righ anon
To bedde gooth Aleyn and also Iohn
Ther nas no more hem nedeth no dwale
This myllere hath so wisly bilbed ale
That as an hors he fnortheth in his slelp
Ne of his tail be hynde he toke ne kepe
His wif bar hym a bordoun ful strong
Men myght hyr routyng heren a forlong
The wenche routehhtrouthtrouteht ek ꝑpar compaignye
Aleyn the clerk that herd this melodie
He poketh Iohn and seid slepestow
HerdsestowHerstowHerdestow euer slik a song er now
Lo slik a couplyng is y mel hem alle
A wilde fir on ther bodies falle
Wha herkned eủere slik a ferly thyng
Ye they shal haue the flour of elle endyng
This longe nyght ther tides me no reste
But yt na force alshal be for the beste
For Iohn seide he as eủere mot y thryue
Gif that y may yond wenche wol I swyue
Som esement has lawe y shapen vs
For Iohn ther is a lawe that sais thus
That yf a man in a poynt be a greued
That in a nother he shal be releved
Oure corn is stolne soothly it is no nay
And we han hadde an ille fit this day
An syn I shal haue nan a mendement
A gayn my losse y wil havne hanhave esement
By goddes saule it sal nan other be
This Iohn answerd Aleyn auyse the
The Millere is ꝑperilous man he seide
And if that he out of his slep̄e braide
He myght doon vs booth a vylaynye
Aleyn answerde y counte hym nat a flye
